Selected Answer: AC
Study guide 7.0 Page 36

Selected Answer: AC
Normalized interfaces are not supported for SD-WAN templates. You can create multiple SD-WAN zones and add interface members to the SD-WAN zones. You must bind the interface members by name to physical interfaces or VPN interfaces.https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.0.0/sd-wan-new-features/794804/new-sd-wan-template-fmg
A and C. SD-WAN objects are stored in ADOM common object database and "central management" indicates templates will be used.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about SD-WAN central management are true? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The packet size exceeded the outgoing interface MTU.
choices.A: The total number of daily sessions for 10.1.10.1 exceeded the maximum number of concurrent sessions configured in the traffic shaper, and the packet was dropped.
choices.D: The number of concurrent sessions for 10.1.10.1 exceeded the maximum number of concurrent sessions configured in the firewall policy, and the packet was dropped.
choices.C: The number of concurrent sessions for 10.1.10.1 exceeded the maximum number of concurrent sessions configured in the traffic shaper, and the packet was dropped.

discussion.content: C is correct

Selected Answer: C
In a Per-IP shaper configuration, if an IP address exceeds the configured concurrent session limit, the message "Denied by quota check" appears.

SD-WAN 7.0 Study Guide page 287

questions.question_text: Which are two benefits of using CLI templates in FortiManager? (Choose two.)

choices.D: You can configure advanced CLI settings.
choices.B: You can configure interfaces as SD-WAN members without having to remove references first.
choices.C: You can configure FortiManager to sync local configuration changes made on the managed device, to the CLI template.

discussion.content: A,D are correct.
